description.value:
You create an &Reference[ill]{illusion} of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon within range that activates when a specific condition occurs. The &Reference[ill]{illusion} is imperceptible until then. It must be no larger than a 30-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}, and you decide when you cast the spell how the &Reference[ill]{illusion} behaves and what sounds it makes. This scripted &Reference[prf]{performance} can last up to 5 minutes.

When the condition you specify occurs, the &Reference[ill]{illusion} springs into existence and performs in the manner you described. Once the &Reference[ill]{illusion} finishes performing, it disappears and remains dormant for 10 minutes. After this time, the &Reference[ill]{illusion} can be activated again.

The triggering condition can be as general or as detailed as you like, though it must be based on visual or audible conditions that occur within 30 feet of the area. For example, you could create an &Reference[ill]{illusion} of yourself to appear and warn off others who attempt to open a trapped door, or you could set the &Reference[ill]{illusion} to trigger only when a creature says the correct word or phrase.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an &Reference[ill]{illusion}, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an &Reference[ill]{illusion} with a successful &Reference[int]{Intelligence} (&Reference[inv]{Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the &Reference[ill]{illusion} for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and any noise it makes sounds hollow to the creature.

materials.value: a bit of fleece and jade dust worth at least 25 gp
